org.logicmill.util.concurrent

Class EntryCountException

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • java.lang.Exception
        • org.logicmill.util.concurrent.SegmentIntegrityException
          • org.logicmill.util.concurrent.EntryCountException
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class EntryCountException
extends SegmentIntegrityException
    Thrown by ConcurrentHashMapAuditor.verifyMapIntegrity(boolean, int) to indicate internal disagreement regarding the number of entries in a segment. Each segment maintains an explicit entry count, incrementing on successful put operations and decrementing on successful remove operations. The integrity check counts entries reachable in bucket lists, and non-null entry references in the ConcurrentHashMap.Segment.entries array. All three counts should agree.
    Author:
    David Curtis
    See Also:

      • EntryCountException

        public EntryCountException(ConcurrentHashMapProbe.SegmentProbe segmentProbe,
                   int entryCountInBuckets,
                   int segmentEntryCount,
                   int nonNullEntryCount)
        Creates an EntryCountException with the specified details.
        Parameters:
        segmentProbe - proxy for segment in which exception occurred; uses reflection to access private segment internals
        entryCountInBuckets - count of entries reachable in bucket lists
        segmentEntryCount - count of entries maintained by put and remove operations
        nonNullEntryCount - count of non-null references in entries array
